short_summary: Banff East Gate Water Treatment Project
description: The Canadian Federal Government, Parks Canada, is seeking bids for stage one of a two-stage procurement for the Banff East Gate Water Treatment project in Banff, Alberta, Canada. The project involves the installation of a new water treatment system, including construction of a treatment building, distribution of treated water, and upgrades to the existing Banff East Gate wastewater system. The requested services are: Perform and complete the work of installing new equipment, materials, and related work for the Banff East Gate Water Treatment Project. This includes the supply and installation of new water treatment equipment, associated piping, and electrical / instrumentation. Additionally, all sensors and equipment must be connected to and controlled by a programmable logic controller (PLC) to provide plant monitoring, alarm, automatic shutdown, and communication functionality. and coordinated with the approved system integrator Deployment of the system as a complete entity to demand not to exceed 3 m3 per day The procurement includes the installation of new water storage tanks, treated water distribution pumps, and related work.
full_summary:
## Stage 1 – Banff East Gate Water Treatment Project

### Solicitation Information

* **Solicitation Number:** 5P468-24-0140/A
* **Amendment Number:** 0
* **Tender Closing Date:** December 10, 2024, 16:00:00 MST
* **Publication Date:** November 21, 2024
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** January 7, 2025
* **Expected Contract End Date:** April 30, 2025

### Project Overview

The Parks Canada Agency is seeking a qualified contractor to perform the Banff East Gate Water Treatment Project in Banff National Park. The project involves the supply and installation of new water treatment equipment, associated piping, and electrical/instrumentation. The work will consist of:

* Supply and installation of a cartridge filtration system
* Supply and installation of a UV Disinfection system
* Supply and installation of an HDPE treated water storage tank, distribution pumping, and re-circulation system
* Supply and installation of electrical and control systems for new water treatment equipment and pumping systems
* Upgrade of instruments and controls for the existing septic tank and pump
* Supply and installation of new electrical and control systems for the existing well pump
* Programming and start-up of the overall system

### Requirements and Instructions

* Bidders are required to submit a bid in two stages.
* The first stage (Stage One) will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers.
* The second stage (Stage Two) will invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project.
* Bidders must submit their bid electronically via fax or email to the address specified in the solicitation document.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.
* Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted.
* Bidders are required to participate in a teleconference on November 28, 2024, to review the scope of the requirement and submit questions.

### Contact Information

* Jen Maheu, Contracting Authority
* jennifer.maheu@pc.gc.ca
* (587) 432-8458
* soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca (for electronic submissions)

### Important Notes

* National Parks Regulations require that all work is done in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
